info.title: Trinsic Credentials API
info.description: An API to issue, manage, and verify self-sovereign identity credentials

accessToken.description: Standard Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example "Bearer {token}"
accessToken.name: Authorization

post.description: Upload an image and return a URL with the static remote location

get.description: Returns a list of available ledger networks. Some networks are available based on your subscription.
Retrieve a list of all connections. Optionally, list only connections in a specified state.

post.description:
Initiate a new connection by creating an invitation. The newly created connection record will be in state 'Invited' until the other party has accepted the invitation. The response body includes details about the newly creation connection
Please check the documentation on how to present the invitation data to mobile clients using a QR code.

get.description: Get the details of a connection (including invitation details). Please check the documentation on how to get connection by sending the connectionId.
Lists the credentials.

post.description: This will send a credential offer of the specified definitionId to the specified connectionId. Please check the documentation on how to send credential offer.
post.summary: Sends credential offer of the specified DefinitionId to the specified ConnectionId

parameters.name: credentialOfferParameters
parameters.description: The definition and connection to which this offer will be sent.

get.description: Gets the credentials.

put.description: This simply needs the credential identifier. Please check the documentation on how to issue a credential.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
If the values offered were incorrect, changes to the values may be made here. You must update all of the values, and they must be follow the same structure of the schema.
            To keep the values the same as those included in the credential offer, leave the body blank

delete.description: Revoke credential that was issued previously. Process of revocation will update the revocation registry locally and on the ledger. Issued credentials can still participate in proof workflows and be considered valid, but only if the verifying ignores the revocation trail. Please check the documentation on how to issue a credential.

get.description: List all credential definitions by this issuer.
get.summary: List all credential definitions by this issuer.

post.description: A credential definition is created and saved on your cloud agent. Please check the documentation on how to create new credential definition.
post.summary: Create new credential definition and schema with the given parameters.

get.description: Get the credential definition with the specified identifier.
get.summary: Get the credential definition with the specified identifier.

get.description: List the schemas registered or used by this issuer.
get.summary: List the schemas registered or used by this issuer.

post.description: Register schema with the current agency tenant and write the schema to the ledger using the tenant as issuer. This does not create credential definition. Please check the documentation on how to create new schema.

get.description: Get a collection of available tenants for the current authorization context.

post.description: Create new tenant and setup a unique agency endpoint. The agency will be set as an issuer

parameters.name: tenantParameters
parameters.description: Configuration options for creating new tenant.

get.description: Returns the agent configuration

delete.description:
Permanently remove a tenant, including their wallet, endpoint registrations and all data.
            All definitions, connections and credentials issued will be deleted.
            This action cannot be reverted.

get.description: Please check the documentation on how to list verification credentials by connection id.

post.description: This endpoint can be used to send a verification definition to a connection, which will create a verification ID to track the response from the connection. Please check the documentation on how to create verification credentials. If the parameter {connectionId} is not specified, this endpoint will create a connectionless verification. A URL will be generated that can be shared with anonymous user.

get.description: Please check the documentation on how to list verification credentials by verification id.
get.summary: Get the verification with the given identifier

get.description: Use the verification definition ID to get a specific verification definition. Please check the documentation on how to get verification definition by definition Id.
This will list all of the verification definitions that you have created with your organization. Please check the documentation on how to list verification definitions.

post.description: A verification definition is created and saved on your cloud agent. You can discover your definition based on the ID that is returned or the name. Please check the documentation on how to create new verification definition.

get.description: Please check the documentation on how to list webhooks.

post.description: Please check the documentation on how to create a webhook.

delete.description: Please check the documentation on how to remove a webhook.

put.description: Please check the documentation on how to enable a webhook.
Please check the documentation on how to disable a webhook.

get.description:
Return the latest transaction author agreement and acceptance methods if one 
is set on the network with the specified {networkId}
get.summary:
Return the latest transaction author agreement and acceptance methods if one 
is set on the network with the specified {networkId}

put.description: Accept the latest transaction author agreement on the specified network.
put.summary: Accept the latest transaction author agreement on the specified network.

post.description: Please check the documentation on how to create new credential definition from schema id.
post.summary: Create credential definition from existing schema identifier.

get.description:
If the tenant is configured with Dedicated endorsement, this
action will check if the issuer DID has the required ENDORSER role 
on the configured ledger network.
Additionally, check the acceptance of the transaction
author agreement and return the text and version if acceptance
is required.
get.summary: Get the issuer status for the current tenant.

get.description:
Execute verification on this record. This is an expensive action and is executed
by veryfing the proof againt the ledger data.
get.summary:
Execute verification on this record. This is an expensive action and is executed
by veryfing the proof againt the ledger data.

get.description: Lists the verification policies.
Gets the verification policy.

put.description: Send a verification to the specified connection from existing policy
put.summary: Send a verification to the specified connection from existing policy

put.description:
Connectionless transport uses URLs that can be shared with the user over any 
existing transport (email, SMS, web).
put.summary: Create a verification from existing policy used for connectionless transport.

post.description:
Connectionless transport uses URLs that can be shared with the user over any
existing transport (email, SMS, web).
post.summary: Create a verification from parameters used for connectionless transport.

post.description: Send a verification to the specified connection from parameters
post.summary: Send a verification to the specified connection from parameters

delete.description: This endpoint doesn't revoke the credential.

put.description: Creates and send a verification from an existing proposal
put.summary: Creates and send a verification from an existing proposal

connectionId.description: Unique connection identifier. If not specified, a random one will be generated.

multiParty.description:
If set to 'true', the invitation can be used by multiple parties and will always have the status set to 'Invited'.
When a party accepts this invitation, a new connection record with a unique identifier will be created.
            
Default value is 'false'.

name.description:
Name that can be used as organization name
            
Default value is 'null'.

definitionId.description: Gets or sets the credential definition identifier.

connectionId.description:
Connection identifier to send this credential to.
If ommited, the request will be treated as connectionless
issuance and will generate a URL.

automaticIssuance.description:
If true, the credential will automatically be issued once the individual accepts the offer. If 
false, when an individual accepts the offer the credential will be in state 'Requested' and must be manually issued using the 
PUT /credentials/{credentialId} endpoint. This is set to false by default

CredentialDefinitionFromSchemaParameters.description: Represents a request object to create new credential definition for an agency

tag.description: Unique tag to differentiate definitions of the same schema
Unique tag to differentiate definitions of the same schema

attributeNames.description: Gets or sets the attribute names.

issuerKeyGenerationSeed.description: Isuser key generation seed used for deterministic key creation (32 characters)

agentKeyGenerationSeed.description: Agent key generation seed used for deterministic key creation (32 characters)

imageUrl.description: Gets or sets the image URI.

tenantId.description: Gets or sets the tenant identifier.

TenantParameters.description: Configuration options for creating new tenant

issuerSeed.description:
(Optional) Issuer seed used for deterministic DID generation.
If omitted, a random DID/Key is generated

imageUrl.description: (Optional) Location of image URL used as profile for this tenant

networkId.description: (Optional) Ledger network identifier. Default is Sovrin Staging (sovrin-staging)

requireAcceptance.description:
Indicates if user needs to accept the 
latest agreement on the network

issuerCanEndorse.description: Indicates if the user has Endorser status

valid.description: True if verification passed, otherwise False
